title: [Self-directed] Science Education Curriculum Integrating Ignatian Pedagogy and Universal Design for Learning (UDL)

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level theoretical and practical knowledge in science, with basic competency in online learning tools
context.additional_context: Content optimized for smartphone-based learning, with project-based assessment systems focused on practical application

learning_goals: Learners can design a science education program by applying the five principles of Ignatian pedagogy (context, experience, reflection, action, evaluation) to universal instructional design.
Learners can develop science education materials accessible even in limited technological environments (e.g., smartphones) to meet the needs of medium-sized learner groups.
Through project-based assessments, learners can apply science education solutions incorporating universal design principles to practical settings and analyze their effectiveness.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
